sect1.title: Common GUI routines (and classes) for python PyGobject (Gtk) development.
sect1.para: Just a sampler of what is in there (pasted from code, in no particular order):

listitem.para: class CairoHelper(): class TextTable(Gtk.Table): class TextRow(Gtk.HBox): class RadioGroup(Gtk.Frame):

sect1.para: These classes act as a simplification of the PyGtk (PyGobject) classes.

For instance the Label takes a constructor, and feeds the arguments as one would expect. Like this: def __init__(self, textm = "", widget = None, tooltip=None, font = None): The defaults are set to a reasonable value, and the named argument can be set on one line. This makes the code look compact and maintainable.
See descendent projects for examples. (pyedpro; pycal; pggui; ...)
